definition: to be deficient in sth/to be short of sth (supplies, money etc)
Poverty is a stranger to industry. (idiom)
pinyin: qin2 lao2 bu4 yu2 kui4 fa2

sentences.english: In low-resource settings, infectious diseases continue to be the major killer.
sentences.chinese: 在資源匱乏地區，傳染病仍然是主要殺手。

sentences.english: Financing is difficult in the commercial forest market in China.
sentences.chinese: 目前中國商品林市場融資困難，渠道匱乏。

sentences.english: So there is a lack of insurance kinds, intermediary mechanisms are imperfect.
sentences.chinese: 中介機構不完善，運動員保險中介人才匱乏。

sentences.english: These, however, remain to be assessed for use in resource-poor settings.
sentences.chinese: 但要在資源匱乏情況下使用這些策略還需要做出評估。

sentences.english: Think of it as a waste-not, want-not kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 把便當視爲一個不浪費，不匱乏的小廚房。

sentences.english: The apartments were built to ease the housing shortage.
sentences.chinese: 那些公寓被建造以紓解房屋匱乏。

sentences.english: Pointed out:main difficult position of scientific and technical periodicals were the sunds short of supplies of run a newspaper in present stage.
sentences.chinese: 指出當前科技期刊面臨的主要困境是辦刊經費匱乏。

sentences.english: It is the vital second front in the battle against creative mediocrity.
sentences.chinese: 因爲這是在反對創意匱乏的戰役中重要的第二戰線。

sentences.english: However, in leaner times having a daughter is a safer bet.
sentences.chinese: “然而在物資匱乏年代，生女孩是較安全賭注”。

sentences.english: In the days of material scarcity, we could only afford to buy 100 grams of peanuts, some sunflower seeds and some fruit candies.
sentences.chinese: 物質匱乏的時候只能買二兩花生，瓜子和水果糖。

sentences.english: Tea and sugar were scarce and were rationed during the war.
sentences.chinese: 在戰爭年代，茶和糖匱乏，均爲定量供應。

sentences.english: As a result of the plague, much land was left untended and there was a terrible shortage of labour.
sentences.chinese: 鼠疫導致了大片土地無人照管和勞動力極度匱乏。

sentences.english: In the days of material scarcity, we could only afford to buy 100 grams of peanuts, some sunflower seeds and some fruit candies. Nowadays, we enjoy all kinds of goods.
sentences.chinese: 物質匱乏的時候只能買二兩花生，瓜子和水果糖。

sentences.english: Because of the lack of support for scientific research, Chinese medicines inch forward sluggishly.
sentences.chinese: 由於科研支援匱乏，中藥產品的發展亦舉步爲艱。

sentences.english: Those content with few desires will never want.
sentences.chinese: 常常少欲滿足的人，纔是無虞匱乏的富人。

sentences.english: ” their answers would be scarcity of basic necessities.
sentences.chinese: 他們的回答將會是基本的必需品匱乏。

definition: to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
Ziyuan county in Guilin 桂林[Gui4 lin2], Guangxi
natural resource (such as water or minerals)/resource (such as manpower or tourism)
to furnish/to provide/supply (as in supply and demand)
